page.title: 03LEGENDS OF THE CROSS
page.content: There are many legends associated with Copplestone Cross. It does after all commemorate the murder of a Bishop. The main legend says that a curse will fall on anyone who moves the stone, and they will shortly die. When it was decided the cross must be moved because it was a danger to traffic, many workmen refused to touch it. When it was eventually excavated, several lucky charms were found buried underneath, and these were replaced under the stone in its new position. However, the locals will tell you that of all the men involved in working to move it, nearly all suffered a dreadful fate in the following months, and the man who took the decision to move it became ill within days, and died a week later.
